headline: Poll: JD Vance Gains in Ohio Senate Race, Tied with Gibbons and Mandel for Lead (Portman preferred Timken drops lower)
sentences:
Vance from Opponents’ ‘Lies’: ‘JD is 100% America First’ https://www.breitbart.com/politics/2022/03/22/donald-trump-jr-backs-up-j-d-vance-from-opponents-lies-jd-is-100-america-first/



To: conservative98

I’m going to be honest, I’ve been extremely skeptical of @JDVance1.

To: conservative98

your right to be skeptical but we should whenever able, vote for the “new blood” and being from Middletown I think JD Vance brings that experience with him to help break through to the undecideds in the forgotten middle and lower class.

Most significant, though, is that the poll shows Gibbons stagnating with 18 percent after having failed to gain any traction since February, whereas Vance and Mandel have each risen to the top of the pack among the five leading candidates.

The poll had voters watch the PAC’s latest ad for Vance where he outlines a fierce immigration agenda that includes fully funding Trump’s border wall, ending welfare benefits for illegal aliens, and defunding sanctuary jurisdictions.

The Protect Ohio Values PAC poll, released on Wednesday, finds that Vance has gained four points since February — running at 18 percent and tied with fellow Republicans Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel, who are also at 18 percent.

“JD Vance is the conservative warrior that the entire America First movement needs fighting for us in the U.S. Senate, and that’s why I’m proud to endorse him,” said Greene, in a statement released by the Vance campaign.

US: Ohio

jdvance

joshmandel

ohio

polls

trump

The silly fight between Gibbons and Mandel likely moved people to Vance.
Meanwhile, Jane Timken, the former chairwoman of the Ohio Republican Party, has dropped in the polls from 12 percent in February to just nine percent in March among primary voters.
However, after carefully observing all of his debate performances and media appearances, I am wholeheartedly convinced that he is one of the best Senate candidates this cycle.
